RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 18 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ANAAMY rushed up from along the rail to vie for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of JERSEY LILLIE in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, and got the better of her pace rival late to prevail. JERSEY LILLIE away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of ANAAMY entering the first turn, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backside and through the final turn, held the narrowest of advantages into the lane, but was unable to dispose of a stubborn rival late to just miss. HARLAN'S ANGEL tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, mounted a two wide bid entering the final turn, and closed evenly three wide in the drive to garner a share. IMA DAREDEVIL stalked the leaders from the back of a compact field while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. PINEAPPLE TIDBITS broke sharply and stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, but was unable to make a late impact while finishing along the inside in the stretch drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Anaamy
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied rail, rallied inside, closed rail, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Jersey Lillie
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Harlan's Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Pineapple Tidbits
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked inside, rallied rail, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Ima Daredevil
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 13000. (PLUS UP TO $6,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race June 18 Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000. (Races where entered for $6250 or less not considered in allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SILK STILETTOS broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace through the stretch the first time and through the second turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of ARTISTIC JEWLER in the run down the backside and through the final turn, and got the batter of that rival in the closing strides to prevail. ARTISTIC JEWLER tracked the pacesetter through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, took a narrow advantage into the lane, but was unable to fend off a determined SILK STILETTOS in the final strides. TEXAS HUMOR away alertly and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, settled off the contested pace in the run down the backside, rallied two wide into the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. KAY'S KITCHEN stalked the leader into the second turn while saving ground at the rail, settled well off the contested pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, but failed to mount a late bid. ANIMA away well and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, settled well off the pacesetters in the run down the backstretch and failed to mount a late bid when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Silk Stilettos
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Artistic Jewler
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Anima
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3w, settled 3w, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Humor
ENTRY.OWNER: GO Stables and Ramirez Alexa Danae
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked 3 w, settled 2 w, rallied 2 w, lacked kick

ENTRY.NAME: Kay's Kitchen
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, never menaced

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 15000. (PLUS UP TO $7,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 18 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered Fo r $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INDYETTA away well and raced to the lead from along the rail in the run to the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backside and through the final turn, started to get the better of her pace rival entering the lane, and drew clear in the drive. TIME TICKER away alertly, but eased into a stalking trip from along the rail entering the first turn, rallied smartly from just off the rail entering the final turn, and finished willingly from along the inside in the drive to prove clearly second best. BACK SHACK pressed the leader two wide entering the first turn, continued to force the issue from the outside of INDYETTA in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival entering the lane, and finished two wide in the drive to garner a share. LOVEABOVEANDBEYOND broke sharply and tracked the dueling leaders in the run down the backside while racing one out from the rail, loomed a danger while mounting a three wide bid entering the final turn, but was unable to sustain her bid late while being outfinished. ROAD CLOSURE settled at the back of a compact field while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but was unable to make a serious late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Indyetta
ENTRY.OWNER: Albertson Brian and The Estate of Dennis Tucker
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Time Ticker
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Back Shack
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Loveaboveandbeyond
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Road Closure
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 92. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 21000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 18 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $ 1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AQUITANIA ARRIVAL away well and dueled for the lead from between rivals entering the first turn, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, got the better of his pace rival entering the lane, and inched clear late to prove best. STORMY BLUE stalked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished willingly three wide in the drive to get up for the place. FINDING WAYS away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival entering the lane, and faded in the late stages. FOREIGN PROTOCOL settled at the back of the pack while racing one out from the rail entering the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. I'M CORFU broke sharply and chased the leaders three wide into the first turn, continued to force the issue two out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, struggled to keep tabs on his pace rivals entering the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Stormy Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Finding Ways
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Foreign Protocol
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Aquitania Arrival
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, led, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: I'm Corfu
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, pressed 3 wide, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 18 Allo wed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 18 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIZZIES GIRL broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch, maintained a narrow advantage through the final turn, and inched clear late to prove best. BAKFIRE BABY away alertly and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained her position in the run down the backstretch, forced the issue two wide entering the final turn, was no match for the winner late, but finished well two wide in the drive to prove second best. BAKZONE away well and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, held her position in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. WALKINTHEWALK settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, pulled her way into a stalking trip in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside through the final turn, but needed more late while finishing at the rail in the drive. STORM CRUISER unhurried early while dropping back to trail entering the first turn, was always well back and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Bakfire Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lizzies Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: Walkinthewalk
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, stalked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Cruiser
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Bakzone
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race at a mile or over Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 18 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility And Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOOD BYE PUTIN settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, continued to save ground in the run down the backside, rallied smartly from just off the rail entering the final turn, altered his path towards the rail when in tight quarters, and in turn took the path away from COUNTRY COWBOY, and finished strongly at the rail in the drive to get up in time. AVE'S IN COMMAND raced to the lead entering the first turn, and controlled the pace through the second turn and in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly two wide through the final turn, held a clear advantage into the lane while drifting in slightly, straightened out from the drive and finished determinedly two wide in the lane to prove second best. FAMILY BIZ stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, mounted a three wide bid entering the final turn, and closed with late interest five wide in the drive. APPELLANT settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, maintained a striking position in the run down the backside, rallied from just off the rail through the final turn, and closed evenly two wide in the drive. COUNTRY COWBOY away alertly and tracked the leader from along the inside entering the lane the first time, chased the leader from along the rail in the run to the final turn, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, steadied sharply when put in tight quarters at the rail entering the lane, and lost all momentum and dropped back in the drive. SLEW'S DA BOSS lagged well off the early pace while racing two wide through the stretch the first time, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to seriously threaten late while finishing three wide in the drive. BARNEY GOOGLE trailed the field through the stretch the first time, was content to bid his time at the back of the pack in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but needed more late when called upon. JUST MAKE BELIEVE stalked the early pace while racing two out from the rail through the stretch the first time, maintained a stalking trip in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. WISE MARKET broke sharply and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong. Following the running of this race there was both a jockey's claim of foul, and well as a stewards inquiry into an incident entering the lane. the rider of COUNTRY COWBOY lodged a claim of foul against the rider of GOOD BYE PUTIN. After review the jockey's claim of foul was disallowed, but the stewards inquiry resulted in AVE'S IN COMMAND being disqualified from second and placed fifth for starting a chain reaction that resulted in COUNTRY COWBOY losing his path entering the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Good Bye Putin
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed rail, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Wise Market
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Country Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked inside, steadied 1/16, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Family Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Appellant
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Barney Google
ENTRY.OWNER: Roberts-Henson Michelle Henson Brad Henson Randy Henson Dan and Irwin Trevor
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Ave's in Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Just Make Believe
ENTRY.OWNER: Last Call Racing Stable and Bornn Cathy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Slew's Da Boss
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Mel Corsan Doug and Houweling Len
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. ; A Race Since June 18 A llowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YOU DON'T OWN ME stalked the dueling leaders in the run down the backside while saving ground at the rail, launched his bid three wide from between rivals entering the final turn, and finished gamely three wide in the drive to prevail. KNOPFLER stalked the contested early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied four wide through the final turn, and closed willingly three out from the rail in the drive to just miss. RING OF KERRY settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid three out from the rail entering the final turn, and finished best of all four wide in the drive to get up for a share. I'M A CHI TOO away well and tracked the dueling leaders from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, awaited room along the inside approaching the final turn, rallied three wide through the turn, and finished willingly two out from the rail in the drive. BILLS SMOKN BULLET away alertly and dueled for the lead two wide entering the first turn, forced the issue one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide from between rivals through the final turn, was overtaken leaving the turn, bumped solidly, and pinballed for a couple strides entering the lane, and finished two wide in the lane. DEPUTY'S DANCER broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch, continued to battle for the lead from along the rail through the final turn, was overtaken leaving the turn, drifted out under right handed urging entering the lane, bumping with BILLS SMOKN BULLET, and faded in the late stages. PADDY D'ORO was bumped and squeezed in the opening strides, and settled well off the early pace while racing two wide into the backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. DRILLER settled well off the early pace, rallied four wide entering the final turn, but was unable to make a serious late impact. ANOTHER GUINNESS settled off the early pace while racing three out from the rail entering the backstretch, dropped back to trail in the run to the final turn, and showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Ring of Kerry
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Deputy's Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, bumped foe, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Driller
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, rallied 4 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Paddy d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed start, settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bills Smokn Bullet
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, bumped 1/16, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: You Don't Own Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Another Guinness
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, showed little

ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,
